title: Three New Figma Buzz Features Empower Designers and Marketers to Accelerate Brand Momentum

paragraphs.content: Figma has launched three key features for Figma Buzz—configurable templates, plugin support, and video trimming—to streamline branded asset creation. Configurable templates leverage component properties and variables, enabling marketers to switch layouts and themes while staying on-brand. These tools connect directly to design systems, reducing the need for multiple file variations.

paragraphs.content: Plugin integration expands functionality for asset management, translation, and animation, with options to create and share custom plugins. Video trimming allows precise in-app edits, eliminating tool-switching for collages and ads. These updates position Buzz as a scalable content factory for social media, events, and campaigns.

sections.title: Configurable Templates Link Buzz to Design Systems for Flexible Asset Creation

paragraphs.content: Teams build templates using component properties like variants, booleans, and instance swaps, which Figma Buzz converts into browsable options. Marketers access a "Change layout" panel to preview variations and customize without detaching elements, preserving content edits. Publishing supports mixing template sets with singles, with reviews for property conflicts.

paragraphs.content: Variable modes enable toggling brand elements like colors or markets via a dedicated switcher, all powered by Figma Design libraries. An "Add all" button facilitates bulk insertion of template sets for rapid campaigns. Nested components remain linked to originals for updates, ensuring consistency.

sections.title: Plugins and Video Tools Boost Buzz Efficiency for Motion and Multimedia

paragraphs.content: Plugins provide access to digital asset management, localization, animations, and QR codes, with demos showing on-canvas motion for headlines and interactions. Teams create internal plugins or publish to the Figma Community for broader use. Video trimming offers granular control for syncing clips in assets like Instagram stories.

paragraphs.content: These features integrate with ChatGPT's Figma app for prompt-based generation of Buzz assets, available on all plans outside the EU. Industry views highlight Buzz replacing Canva-like tools with designer-controlled scale. Ongoing 2025 updates, including over 150 features, solidify Figma as a full-stack design platform.
